passage_text: Any land area surrounded entirely by water is considered an island. The exception to this definition is a land area of continental size, such as Australia, which is considered a nation-continent.

FIND OUT MORE. An island is an area of land smaller than a continent and entirely surrounded by water. Islands range from single rocks to huge landmasses, such as the island of Greenland. There are two main types of island—continental islands and oceanic islands. Islands are also found in rivers and lakes.
